items.title: In a Kenyan refugee camp, farming is the path to self-sufficiency
items.summary: Sarah Sikatenda, a refugee from Democratic Republic of Congo, now farms to feed her family and build a future.

items.title: A violet chair to give indigenous women a seat at the table
items.summary: Campaign to promote indigenous women’s rights and role in policy discussions for Zero Hunger

items.title: FAO launches campaign to empower indigenous women in Asia and Pacific
items.summary: Asia is home to the largest number of indigenous peoples on Earth, with an estimated 260 million of a total of 370 million original inhabitants worldwide.

items.title: Rural women in Kyrgyzstan receive assistance from Swedish funds
items.summary: A programme that helps rural women in Kyrgyzstan gain access to new economic opportunities has received significant financial support from the Swedish government.

items.title: Asia-Pacific countries commit to empower rural women and girls at high-level UN forum
items.summary: Ministers and senior government representatives from Asia and the Pacific have committed to ensuring greater empowerment of rural women and girls to improve their standard of living, food security and livelihoods.

items.title: Technology can be key to empowering rural women
items.summary: While the digital revolution is reaching rural areas in many developing countries, the rural digital divide continues to present considerable challenges. The problem is even more acute for women, who face a triple divide: digital, rural, and gender.

items.title: Information and communications technologies are essential to the empowerment and success of poor rural women
items.summary: This International Women's Day, UN agencies in Rome will focus discussions on the role of information and communications technologies (ICTs) in supporting rural women's economic empowerment, voice and status.

items.title: Sweden strengthens partnership to accelerate economic empowerment for rural women
items.summary: “Sweden is happy to continue supporting a programme that has shown promising results and hopes that these new funds will convince other donors to join the partnership.”

items.title: Rural women as agents of change in migration
items.summary: Six out of ten international migrants reside in Asia and Europe, and a large share of them are from rural areas. Often, when these migrants settle into urban areas and find work, they send money back home to the families they’ve left behind.

items.title: New fish smoking ovens launched in Asia
items.summary: The traditional method of fish-smoking in the small fishing community of Unnichchai, in eastern Sri Lanka sees women spending many hours tending to fish laid out on mesh over smoking coals. Health hazards from smoke inhalation are high, while the output f

items.title: Bringing youth back to agriculture in Southern Africa
items.category: Gender and innovative and labour-saving technologies
items.summary: FAO is seeking innovative ways to make the agricultural value chain more attractive to youth, thereby curtailing ‘distress migration’ and helping to provide decent employment and improved livelihoods across the continent.

items.title: Recognizing women’s role in managing Kosovo’s forests
items.summary: A new FAO report highlights the importance of women's involvement in forest work, and calls for their interests to be better considered at both national and municipal levels.

items.title: Gender-based violence affects food security and nutrition
items.category: Gender and food security and nutrition
items.summary: Interview with FAO’s Deputy Director-General, Daniel Gustafson

items.title: Women's empowerment is key to fighting hunger and poverty
items.summary: FAO and the African Union (AU) Commission convened a three-day Africa-wide consultative meeting on rural women and gender in the context of the AU Agenda 2063.

items.title: New FAO-World Bank programme to scale up assistance for women, men and families in Yemen
items.category: Gender and emergencies and resilience building
items.summary: The $36 million joint project aims at providing immediate assistance to over 630,000 poor and food-insecure people in Yemen — more than 30 percent of whom are women — as well as increasing longer term agricultural resilience in the conflict-ridden country

items.title: Countries in Southern Africa seek innovative ways to involve youth in agriculture
items.category: Gender and innovative and labour-saving technologies
items.summary: Africa is the world’s youngest continent, with almost 200 million people aged between 15 and 24. The potential of this demographic to transform agriculture was a key theme in a meeting held earlier this month in Harare, Zimbabwe.

items.title: Farming and rural non-farm activities can provide solutions to rising youth unemployment in Africa
items.summary: Although ten to 12 million young people join the labor force in Africa each year, only around three million jobs are created annually.

items.title: New FAO data highlights gender gap in food insecurity across regions
items.category: Gender and food security and nutrition
items.summary: Women are more likely to be food insecure than men in every region of the world, according to FAO’s latest report on the State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2017.

items.title: Leaving no one behind: FAO special event highlights rural women’s role in achieving global food and nutrition security
items.summary: Gender equality and women’s empowerment is central to FAO’s work in eradicating hunger and poverty, as it is to the entire 2030 Agenda. This was a key message among several discussed at the recent Special Event on “Leaving no one behind: Achieving gender

items.title: FAO Director-General urges countries to recognize the vital role of rural women in freeing the world from hunger and poverty
items.summary: A special event looks into ways to achieve gender equality for food security, nutrition and sustainable development.

items.title: UN report finds gender inequalities persisting in rural Armenia
items.summary: More than 40 percent of economically active women in Armenia are employed in agriculture, compared to about 30 percent of men.

items.title: The Sustainable Healthy Schools Programme is launched in Chiquimula
items.summary: The rural school Escuela Oficial Rural Mixta “Los Vados” is the first of twelve that will implement the sustainable healthy school model in the department of Chiquimula.

items.title: Notimex joins the #MujeresRurales, mujeres con derechos campaign (#RuralWomen, women with rights)
items.summary: Notimex will produce and disseminate news content to raise awareness about rural women's key role in achieving sustainable development.

items.title: FAO delivers message of solidarity at ECOWAS ministerial session on gender equality
items.summary: A strong call to ECOWAS member countries to empower women in agriculture.

items.title: FAO contributes to dialogue on women’s empowerment
items.summary: A Gambian side-event at CSW61 called for reliable data and information for the elaboration of gender responsive policies.

items.title: Enhancing social protection as a critical component of reducing rural poverty and gender inequality
items.summary: “Social protection can be a powerful tool to break the negative spiral of gender inequalities,” said Ms. Carla Mucavi, Director of the FAO Liaison Office to the United Nations in New York in her remarks at a side event during the sixty-first session of

items.title: Striving to leave no one behind: FAO kicks off 2017 Commission on Status of Women with three side events on empowering rural women
items.summary: The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) contributed prominently to the sixty-first session of the Commission on the Status of Women (CSW61) with three side events on 13 March, the opening day of the two-week session.

items.title: Reaffirmed commitment towards implementing anti-discrimination treaty for women
items.summary: Continuing the strong momentum from three side events on the opening day of the sixty-first session of the Commission on the Status of Women (CSW61), another side event on “Empowering rural and indigenous women to achieve food security and nutrition” took

items.title: Women in Latin America and the Caribbean face greater poverty and obesity compared to men
items.summary: In Latin America, 40% of rural women over the age of 15 do not have their own income, although they work on a daily basis, unpaid. In addition, rural women in the region only have a fraction of the land, credit, productive inputs and education that men do

items.title: In Latin America and the Caribbean: a campaign for the empowerment of rural women
items.summary: A regional campaign, launched on International Women's Day by the FAO Regional Office for Latin America and the Caribbean, will focus on the empowerment of rural women towards sustainable development.

items.title: In Tirana, Albania: an international conference on women’s access to land
items.summary: Women's land rights are vital to every country’s development. Yet, those rights are routinely violated, denied, or simply not enforced.

items.title: UN agencies in Rome step up on gender equality to end hunger and poverty
items.summary: Leaders from the three UN Rome-based agencies today marked International Women's Day by reinforcing their commitments to step up efforts to invest in the capacities of rural women as key agents of change in building a world without hunger.

items.title: FAO study on value chains points to opportunities for Albanian women
items.category: Gender and inclusive food systems and value chains
items.summary: Starting or participating in an agrifood business could make good sense for women in poor rural areas of Albania. A new study identifies several business ideas and examines value chains and markets with potential for improving women’s incomes.

items.title: New book on gender equality and social protection in Eastern Europe and Central Asia
items.summary: Written by economists, sociologists, and gender specialists and practitioners from twelve post-Soviet countries in Eastern Europe, South Caucasus and Central Asia, the publication reviews and analyzes issues that sit at the intersection of gender equality

items.title: Indigenous women from Panama design action plans to ensure food security
items.summary: This program, led by FAO, FIMI and CONAMUIP, aims to provide indigenous women with advocacy tools that allow them to influence public policies, programs and budgets that impact their communities.

items.title: FAO conference in Vilnius focuses on gender equality
items.summary: Challenge: How to make sure rural women benefit from economic growth?

items.title: CELAC adopts gender approach to ensure the impact of its hunger eradication plan
items.summary: A fundamental first step is to incorporate the gender approach into the legal frameworks, laws and policies regarding food security in the region.

items.title: Women hold the key to building a world free from hunger and poverty
items.summary: But gender inequality is putting a brake on sustainable development.

items.title: Albania’s rural women face an uphill climb
items.summary: A new FAO report notes that while initial steps have been taken to alleviate the problems of rural women in the country, gender inequalities are still deeply rooted in society and change needs to be accelerated.

items.title: Leaving no rural woman behind: ECOWAS and FAO champion the cause of rural women in West Africa
items.summary: “Rural women should be equal partners in all areas of decision making on food and agriculture,” said Fatimata Dia Sow, ECOWAS Commissioner for Social Affairs and Gender, on the occasion of the International Day of Rural Women 2016.

items.title: Examples of empowerment: snapshots and stories from rural women around the world
items.summary: On the occasion of the International Day of Rural Women, we take a look at some ways in which a multi-agency programme for the economic empowerment of rural women is making a difference.

items.title: Coming Soon: High-level Event to “Step It Up Together for Rural Women to End Hunger and Poverty”
items.summary: Scheduled for 16 December 2016 at FAO in Rome, Italy, the Event will bring together governments, specialized agencies, civil society and others to reflect on the causes and consequences of gender disparities in rural areas, and to identify challenges and

items.title: FAO and India’s SEWA join efforts to empower rural women and youth
items.summary: New agreement aims to ensure capacity development, farmers’ access to productive resources, knowledge exchange.

items.title: Promoting Pulses in Africa: Zimbabwe's Elizabeth Mpofu named Special Ambassador for FAO's International Year
items.summary: An organic farmer herself, Ms Mpofu has worked tirelessly for the betterment of smallholder farmers and the rights of women.

items.title: Empowering Women in Agriculture: FAO renews commitment towards African Union goals
items.summary: High level breakfast meeting on Empowering Women in Agriculture (EWA) initiative held during 27th session of the African Union Summit in Kigali, Rwanda.

items.title: Gender inequality in the agrifood systems of Latin America and the Caribbean

items.summary: New study highlights the contributions of women to cassava, quinoa, corn and cotton value chains.

items.title: Post-Soviet countries study gender statistics in agriculture
items.summary: Countries from Eastern Europe, South Caucasus and Central Asia participated last week in a Regional Workshop on Gender Statistics for the Agricultural and Rural Sector.

items.title: FAO and India's SEWA seek closer cooperation to boost rural women's access to land, skills and financial resources
items.summary: Partnership would include capacity development and empowerment initiatives.

items.title: Statistics help paint a picture of Central Asia’s rural women
items.summary: FAO presents gender profiles for agricultural and rural sectors of Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan.

items.title: FAO survey on street food vendors in Accra finds women play a central role
items.summary: Interim findings show sector is run mainly by women, and that almost half of all vendors in central Accra operate near a school, making them a central element in the nutrition of school children.

items.title: Zooming in on Dimitra Clubs in the Niger: Niamey meeting highlights gender-sensitive communication tool
items.summary: Earlier this month, FAO Representative in the Niger, Lassaad Lachaal, launched "Zoom on the Dimitra Clubs in Niger," a one-day meeting on the key role of Dimitra Clubs in the country's development of rural communities through information and gender-sensit

items.title: Empowering Rural Women in Lebanon through Dairy Production and Processing
items.summary: The new project, launched last month in a ceremony in the city of Aley, will focus on women dairy processors, training in dairy processing techniques, hygiene and disinfection practices.

items.title: For a brighter future in Malawi: reducing and preventing child labour in agriculture
items.summary: Among Malawi's rural women, men and youth, a nationwide mass media campaign is creating awareness and fostering debate about the issues surrounding child labour in agriculture.

items.title: Azerbaijan launches rural advisory services for women
items.summary: An FAO project aims at equal access to rural services for women, along with gender-sensitive agricultural extension services and personnel.

items.title: Indigenous women represent Philippines in global leadership school
items.summary: Sixteen women from across the Cordillera Administrative Region and Mindanao are representing the Philippines in the Global Leadership School of Indigenous Women spearheaded by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) and the Inter

items.title: FAO and ECOWAS declare continuous support for women in agriculture
items.summary: Ministers of Gender and Women’s Affairs from ECOWAS countries pledge to work to ensure that gender is adequately addressed in the implementation of the ECOWAS Zero Hunger Initiative.

items.title: International agencies in Rome together commemorate Women's Day
items.summary: Making collective and individual commitments for achieving worldwide gender equity.

items.title: Stories, successes, and results for rural women’s economic empowerment: joint UN programme gathers speed
items.summary: How a multi-agency programme is making a difference in the lives of rural women around the world.

items.title: Empowering Koinadugu women farmers in Sierra Leone
items.summary: In the framework of its support to Ebola recovery, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) donated a generator to the Koinadugu Women Vegetable Farmers’ Cooperative.

items.title: 2016 African Union Year of Human Rights: FAO and AU focus on women's rights to land, food, decent employment
items.summary: Key stakeholders at AU meetings last month discussed practical actions to improve the livelihoods of African women, particularly in the context of agriculture and agro-processing initiatives.

items.title: Harnessing the power of ICTs to enhance women smallholder farmer productivity and access to markets
items.summary: Closing the digital gender gap: women farmers in South Africa receive ICT training under the “She Will Connect” programme.

items.title: Strengthening ASEAN’s agri-industry through the empowerment of women
items.summary: ASEAN countries could boost productivity of their agribusinesses simply by improving opportunities for women to participate in the sector on an equal footing with men, a senior UN official said.

items.title: Gender in Climate-Smart Agriculture: new module launched at CFS
items.category: Gender and food security and nutrition
items.summary: “Gender in Climate-Smart Agriculture,” the latest module of the Gender in Agriculture Sourcebook, was launched today during a side event of the 42nd session of the Committee on World Food Security (CFS) in Rome. The publication provides comprehensive guid

items.title: The Power of the Adolescent Girl: FAO, UN, global community mark International Day of the Girl Child
items.summary: There are nearly 600 million girls aged 10 to 19 in the world today. As the global community marks the International Day of the Girl Child this week, FAO recognizes the enormous potential of adolescent girls to transform rural communities and play their p

items.title: Afghanistan: Launch of National Strategy on Women in Agriculture Development
items.summary: Afghanistan’s Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock (MAIL) and the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations have this week launched a “National Strategy on Women in Agriculture Development”.

items.title: Mainstreaming gender in South Africa and beyond: a people-centered approach
items.category: Gender analysis, gender mainstreaming and the project cycle
items.summary: Her Excellency the Honourable Baleka Mbete, Speaker of Parliament of the Republic of South Africa, delivered a special address this week at the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), on gender mainstreaming in the African region and beyond.

items.title: Empowering rural women: a solution to end hunger
items.summary: FAO’s Deputy Director of Social Protection, Brave Ndisale, spoke on behalf of the Organization at this year’s Conference on Tropical and Subtropical Agricultural and Natural Resource Management (Tropentag 2015) in Berlin, Germany.

items.title: Angling for gender equality in the seafood industry
items.summary: New FAO report traces fisheries’ glass ceiling.

items.title: New visual guide to protect children from pesticides
items.summary: With the help of a new training guide developed by FAO and the International Labour Organization (ILO), extension workers in Africa and elsewhere are engaging with rural communities to reduce children's exposure to toxic pesticides used in farming.

items.title: Eataly-FAO collaboration bears fruit
items.summary: Jars of cactus pear jam produced in Ethiopia thanks to a partnership between FAO and Italian food store Eataly have reached the shelves of the store in Rome.

items.title: Pêcheurs du Monde: women fish-processors of Burundi in spotlight at film festival in France
items.summary: Over ten years ago, in the village of Mvugo in Burundi, an FAO project set out to improve fish-processing methods with a simple innovation – a system of raised racks for drying fish. Today, the project's impact can be seen across Africa. And this weekend,

items.title: Ethiopian women cooperative increases incomes thanks to FAO-Eataly partnership
items.summary: A cooperative of women in Ethiopia is set to reach the international market thanks to a partnership between Italian gourmet food store Eataly and FAO.

items.title: Int’l Women’s Day 2015: Women farmers key to fighting hunger
items.summary: Marking International Women’s Day 2015 (March 8th), leaders from the United Nations’ three Rome-based food agencies gathered to remind the world that women farmers play a central role in achieving food and nutrition security.

items.title: New fish drying technology boosts livelihoods in Ivorian towns
items.category: Gender and innovative and labour-saving technologies
items.summary: "We are extremely happy, because as of today, with the FTT, our conditions for smoking fish have changed," says Deborah Oulou, an Ivorian woman fish processor.

items.title: African Union Summit: Women's empowerment is key to achieving goals of Agenda 2063
items.summary: African leaders gathered in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, to focus on a continent-wide commitment to end hunger by 2025 and on efforts to boost the role of women in achieving prosperity in Africa. United Nations Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon and FAO Director-Gen

items.summary: African ministers responsible for gender and women’s affairs attended the 9th African Regional Conference on Women for the twenty-year review of the implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action (BPfA), and adopted a Declaration callin

items.title: Family farming in Africa: lessons in closing the gender gap
items.category: Gender and food security and nutrition
items.summary: Closing the gender gap is not only the right thing to do; it is the smart thing to do for improved agriculture and food security for all. This was a key message among several discussed at the recent High Level Side Event on "Family farming interventions t

items.title: New York event highlights the crucial role of rural women in the Post-2015 Development Agenda
items.summary: Rural women and their role in eradicating poverty should be given high priority in the post-2015 development agenda — that was the key message among speakers at a special event to mark the 2014 International Day for Rural Women at UN headquarters in New Y

items.title: E-learning course puts gender equality at the centre of agricultural planning
items.summary: Joint EU-FAO programme supports the learning needs of agricultural and food security professionals.

items.title: Land matters for women, indigenous peoples and a food secure world
items.summary: Securing land rights for vulnerable groups is a necessary step towards achieving greater food security and equality. Land carries social, cultural and economic value, but many find themselves without access to its benefits as a result of exclusionary prac

items.title: High-level meeting at UN headquarters to focus on women's right to land
items.summary: FAO Deputy Director-General for Knowledge, Maria Helena Semedo, will speak at United Nations Headquarters this week, during a high-level Ministerial breakfast meeting on gender equality in land ownership.

items.title: Bite-sized stories: determination and decisions in Gujarat and Lesotho
items.summary: A set of stories that illustrate some of the challenges that rural women farmers face every day, the determined and dynamic ways in which they decide to deal with them, and the ways in which their ingenuity and perseverance lead to greater food security,

items.title: Land ownership still lagging for women in Western Balkans
items.summary: Joint FAO-World Bank project aims to enable change through data-gathering, education.

items.title: Empowering women in agriculture
items.summary: International Women’s Day event at FAO eyes role of gender equality in ending hunger and fostering sustainable food systems

items.title: Bite-sized stories: how rural women farmers are solving problems in Gujarat, India
items.summary: A set of stories that illustrate, through real life examples, how rural women farmers in Gujarat, India found solutions to some of the challenges they faced.

items.title: Women are main guardians of crucial livestock diversity
items.summary: New study argues that to succeed, breed conservation efforts must empower women.

items.title: UN Women, FAO, IFAD and WFP: empowerment of women in rural areas is pre-requisite for global food security
items.summary: UN Women and the three Rome-based United Nations agencies working on food and agriculture today launched a joint programme to empower poor rural women through economic integration and food security initiatives.

items.summary: FAO's Director General José Graziano da Silva, the Executive Director of UN Women, Michelle Bachelet, the Executive Director of WFP, Ertharin Cousin, and representatives of IFAD participated in a high-level meeting at the WFP headquarters to discuss a 5-y

items.title: New gender and land profiles shed light on women’s rights in Central Asia
items.summary: The Gender and Land Rights database (GLRD) launches five new country profiles from Central Asia: Azerbaijan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan, available in English and Russian.

items.title: G(irls)20 summit: closing the gender gap in agriculture

items.title: International Women’s Day: Inspiring better futures for young rural women
items.summary: Creating better opportunities for young women in rural areas was the focus of the UN Rome-based agencies’ -- the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD), the World Food Programme (WFP) and FAO -- commemoration of International Women’s Day t

items.title: International Women’s Day: FAO gender policy aims high
items.summary: Better opportunities for women and girls means leverage in fight against hunger.

items.title: Gender gap imposes large costs on agriculture, economies and society
items.summary: "Rural women are active economic agents who could unleash major advancements in hunger eradication and development if they were able to participate equally with men in the agricultural economy,” said FAO Deputy Director-General Ann Tutwiler, speaking at t

items.title: Empowering Rural Women: CSW 2012’s Priority
items.summary: The 56th session of the Commission on the Status of Women (CSW), the principal global policy-making body committed to gender equality and the advancement of women, meets 27 February- 9 March in New York and is this year dedicated to rural women’s empowerm

items.title: FAO launches website dedicated to closing the gender gap in agriculture
items.summary: FAO today launched the “Men and women in agriculture: closing the gap” website, dedicated to the organization’s latest research and knowledge to close the gender gap in agriculture to achieve food security for all.

items.title: The United Nations Rome-based agencies committed to supporting agricultural cooperatives
items.summary: The UN launched the International Year of Cooperatives 2012 (IYC) on October 31 at the General Assembly in New York. On this occasion, FAO, IFAD and WFP held a side event on the role of agricultural cooperatives in improving the lives of smallholder men a

items.title: Investing in gender equality at the heart of food security
items.summary: Gender equality was discussed as a prominent factor of food security at FAO’s celebration of World Food Day 2011 and throughout the 37th session of the United Nations Committee on Global Food Security (CFS), held at headquarters 17-22 October.

items.title: Lead expert group paves way for improved global institutional and policy framework for rural women’s economic empowerment
items.summary: FAO, the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD), the World Food Programme (WFP) and UN Women convened an Expert Group Meeting from the 20-23 September 2011 in Accra, Ghana to identify strategies and recommendations to enhance the economic

items.title: Forest ownership rights can improve peoples’ livelihoods
items.summary: Reforming forest tenure systems and securing forest ownership rights can significantly improve peoples’ livelihoods and enable them to gain income from forest products, said FAO in a newly published guide, Reforming Forest Tenure.

items.title: FAO’s 37th Biennial Conference: A commitment to women in agriculture at the highest Level
items.summary: The vital role of women in agriculture and rural development was the theme of the thirty-seventh session of the biennial FAO Governing Conference (25 June-2 July 2011).

items.title: Preventing hazardous child labour in agriculture
items.category: Gender and decent rural employment and child labour
items.summary: Worldwide 215 million children are engaged in child labour, and of these 115 million are involved in what is considered to be hazardous work. Agriculture is the sector where the largest share of child labourers is found - a staggering 60 percent of boys a

items.title: Integrating gender in communication for rural development
items.summary: The FAO-Dimitra Project recently launched a handbook for all development practitioners, which examines the need to include gender in communication for rural development initiatives and provides guidance on achieving this successfully.

items.title: FAO report makes strong business case for investing in women
items.summary: If women in rural areas had the same access to land, technology, financial services, education and markets as men, agricultural production could be increased and the number of hungry people reduced by 100-150 million, FAO said today in its 2010-11 edition

items.title: New UN report says rural women face increasing inequality
items.summary: A new United Nations interagency report on the gender dimension of agricultural work says women still benefit less than men from rural employment and face new challenges due to the current economic and food crises.

items.title: FAO backs indigenous people
items.summary: Indigenous people will be given a stronger voice at FAO following the adoption of a new policy designed to ensure that they are considered in all relevant aspects of the agency’s work.

items.title: Recognizing women’s critical roles in responding to conflict
items.summary: October 2010 marked the 10th anniversary of UN Security Council Resolution 1325, which highlights the importance of involving women in all aspects of peacekeeping and peacebuilding to conserve peace, security and livelihoods.

items.title: Strength in numbers: International Day of Cooperatives
items.summary: Agricultural cooperatives can be an effective means to empower women in rural areas and help them to overcome the constraints they face, the Food and Agriculture Organization said in a statement released for the 16th International Day of Cooperatives.

items.title: Full, equal participation of women key to tackling hunger

items.title: FAO at global conference on employment for the future
items.summary: Developing decent work opportunities for both women and men, especially young people new to the labour market, will be the focus of a global summit in Sweden on the future of employment.

items.title: Protecting girls and boys from child labour: global conference
items.summary: FAO took part in a global conference on child labour in The Hague, The Netherlands, to put the spotlight on the key role that agriculture must play in eliminating hazardous and exploitative work for girls and boys.

items.summary: The crucial role of women in food production worldwide and achievement of the Millennium Development Goals was the focus of a panel discussion held 22 April 2010 at UN Headquarters in New York

items.summary: A new FAO toolkit aims to sharpen the focus of anti-hunger and development efforts by helping countries to gather more accurate information on the roles and responsibilities of men and women in agriculture

items.title: Road to Beijing +15: Implementation of women's empowerment agenda key to food security
items.summary: FAO urges focus on rural women’s empowerment and gender equality to meet the commitments made in the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action

items.title: International Women’s Day: FAO, WFP and IFAD honour Haitian women
items.summary: Rome-based UN agencies FAO, World Food Programme (WFP) and the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) marked International Women’s Day by pledging to help women affected by the Haiti earthquake make the challenging transition from emergenc

items.title: FAO launches major review to improve action on gender
items.summary: The United Nations Development Fund for Women (UNIFEM) is conducting a comprehensive gender review, which will lay the groundwork for the development of a strategy to ensure inclusion of gender-responsive actions into FAO’s work at the national, regional

items.summary: FAO Director-General Jacques Diouf: "Women’s empowerment and gender equality are fundamental to FAO’s vision of a world free of hunger and malnutrition"

items.title: Grassroots women meet face-to-face with women leaders
items.summary: Nereide Segala Coelho, a Brazilian farmer, was among rural women from Africa, Asia and Latin America who exchanged ideas at a meeting with women ministers and diplomats

items.title: Our new website on gender mainstreaming
items.category: Gender analysis, gender mainstreaming and the project cycle
items.summary: The new site will contribute to a series of global initiatives, focused on ensuring world food security, by highlighting the fundamental role of gender equity in eliminating hunger and poverty

items.title: Global platform for food security revitalized
items.category: Gender and food security and nutrition
items.summary: Faced with rising world hunger and in response to calls for greater coherence and coordination, members of the FAO Committee on World Food Security (CFS) have agreed on a wide-ranging reform, FAO announced today.

items.title: Agriculture to 2050: The challenges ahead
items.summary: Agriculture must become more productive if it is to feed a much larger world population while responding to the daunting environmental challenges ahead, FAO Director-General Jacques Diouf said here today.

items.title: New FAO Goodwill Ambassadors
items.summary: FAO is to honour five new high profile personalities as Goodwill Ambassadors, the agency announced today.

items.title: Good news from Afghanistan
items.summary: There’s not so many feel-good stories coming out of Afghanistan these days, and even fewer about life getting better for women there. But FAO has one to tell.

items.summary: Women make up over half the agriculture labour force yet they are frequently subject to discrimination, poverty and hunger. A new publication launched today investigates the situation of women in the rural workforce and how some of the main challenges fac

items.title: Large-scale biofuel production may increase marginalization of women
items.summary: Rapid increases in the large-scale production of liquid biofuels in developing countries could exacerbate the marginalization of women in rural areas threatening their livelihoods, according to a new FAO study.

items.title: Miriam Makeba visits rape survivors in Congo (DR)
items.summary: Singer and activist Miriam Makeba says women survivors of sexual violence in the Democratic Republic of the Congo face a “triple tragedy” of physical, psychological and social damage

items.title: Climate change a further challenge for gender equity
items.summary: The effect of climate change could in many areas of the world "diminish considerably the progress we have made so far in securing gender equality,” said Iceland’s Minister of the Environment, Ms Thorunn Sveinbjarnardóttir, at an FAO event marking Internat

items.title: Climate change: Focussing on how the vulnerable can cope
items.category: Gender and climate change, agroecology and biodiversity
items.summary: With higher temperatures, unpredictable rainfall, and a potential sea level rise, entailing more frequent or more intense disasters, no part of the world will be safe from the impacts of the changing climate.

items.title: Women fill top posts at FAO
items.summary: FAO Director-General Jacques Diouf has announced the appointment of two women to top positions in the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization.

items.title: Queen Sofia of Spain awarded the Ceres Medal
items.summary: Her Majesty Queen Sofia of Spain was today awarded the Ceres Medal, coined in her honour by FAO in recognition of her efforts to raise the living standards of rural women in developing countries.

items.title: Unequal access to natural resources
items.summary: More than any other group, female-headed households in Ethiopia’s Southern Tigray region – one of the poorest in the world – have little access to tree and plant resources, which are vital for their livelihoods.

items.title: Right agriculture policies can promote healthy diets
items.summary: Agriculture and the right farm policies can promote healthy diets but Europeans are in some ways eating worse now than 45 years ago, an international meeting was told here.

items.title: Education for rural people in the Caribbean
items.summary: International attention turns towards the Caribbean region on the eve of a regional conference on education for rural people to take place in Saint Lucia on 18 and 19 May 2006.

items.title: Literacy and education in fishing communities
items.summary: More accessible and better oriented literacy and education programmes for fishing communities will improve their livelihoods while diversifying their income-generating activities, according to a new report prepared by FAO.

items.title: Ninety-six governments recognize ‘essential role’ of agrarian reform and rural development in fight against poverty
items.summary: Representatives of 96 FAO member countries participating in the International Conference on Agrarian Reform and Rural Development (ICARRD) have recognized the essential role of agrarian reform and rural development for sustainable development.

items.title: Schools for life: Training HIV/AIDS orphans in sub-Saharan Africa
items.summary: On World AIDS Day, FAO profiles one of its activities to help mitigate the impact of HIV/AIDS on rural communities.

items.title: Failure to educate children perpetuates hunger and poverty
items.summary: Top priority should be given to improving access to quality education in rural areas for communities of farmers, fisherfolk, and livestock producers as well as populations living in mountains, forests and deserts, FAO said today.

items.title: Better nutrition education helps reduce malnutrition
items.category: Gender and food security and nutrition
items.summary: Eating well is vital for a healthy and active life, but many people in virtually all countries do not eat well because of poverty and a lack of nutrition education, according to FAO.

items.title: Gender equality: An issue of democracy
items.summary: Sweden’s Agriculture Minister highlighted the role of women in agriculture at a roundtable discussion on gender equality and access to productive resources organized at the 33rd session of the FAO Conference (19-26 November 2005) in Rome.

items.title: FAO Conference to review reform proposals
items.summary: Agriculture ministers and high-level officials from FAO’s Member nations will review wide-ranging reform proposals for the UN agency during the 33rd Session of its governing Conference opening on Saturday.

items.title: New global agricultural census under way
items.summary: More than 100 countries are participating in the UN Food and Agriculture Organization's (FAO) 2010 round of agricultural censuses covering the period 2006-2015, the agency announced today.

items.title: FAO and Brazil collaborate to promote school nutrition and food security
items.category: Gender and food security and nutrition
items.summary: Brazil and FAO will work together on school nutrition programmes in poor countries, according to a multilateral agreement signed in Rome today.

items.title: Celebrating World Food Day around the world
items.summary: More than 150 countries around the world will observe World Food Day with special events, seminars, conferences, contests and media campaigns.
